description:
The ability to reset time might seem like the ultimate superpower, but if you forget what was going to happen when you reset it, how would you know what you needed to change? Or if you'd make things better or worse? That's the paradox that faces Misora Haruki until she's paired with Kei Asai, who remembers everything, even if they happened in timelines that have been reset. But there's still a catch: each reset point can be used only once and anything that happens in the 24 hours before a new one can be set will be locked in time forever.

In a town where a mysterious agency seems to be controlling everything from the shadows and everyone has unexpected powers, the lives of Kei and Misora's friends and classmates will depend on how carefully they can use the Sagrada Reset.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

node.description:
__Place of Birth:__ Tokushima Prefecture, Japan
__Current Residence:__ Hyogo Prefecture, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/konoyutaka)

[Tumblr](https://youshiina.tumblr.com) | [Website](https://youshiina111.wixsite.com/artworks)

__You Shiina__ is a Japanese freelance illustrator. She has done character design and cover illustrations for many Light Novels, children's books, as well as some video games. Formerly a student of famous artist and designer [Range Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/98445).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dekopongas)

Affiliated with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Brother of [Kousuke Kawatsura](https://anilist.co/staff/116501/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ka2hikoTakayama) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/KatsuhikoTakayama00/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuiyui_makino) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/yui-makino/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_makino0119/) | [Website](http://www.yuiyuimakino.com/)

A Japanese voice actor, singer, and pianist. She married the singer-songwriter [Yutaro Miura](https://anilist.co/staff/182317/Yuutarou-Miura) on June 12, 2020. 
 
Makino took up piano at the age of four. Her talent was discovered by the film director Shunji Iwai when she was only seven years old, and from the age of 8 to 17, she played piano solos for three of his films, one of which was _Love Letter_. She then graduated from Tokyo College of Music as piano major in 2008 with the top score in her senior year piano ensemble.

Makino has appeared in two films, several commercials, and a TV Drama. She also sang the ending theme of a Wii game, Arc Rise Fantasia. The song, which she wrote the lyrics and music of herself, was titled "Tenshi no Hashigo ~crepuscular rays~".

She was nominated for "Best Young Seiyuu"  for her outstanding portrayal of Misaki Nakahara in Welcome To The N.H.K!.

**Non-Anime Roles**
- Zhezhi - Wuthering Waves (VG)

name.native: ジ・オーラル・シガレッツ

node.description:
The four-piece rock band formed in Nara in 2010. Since its formation, the band has been aggressive in local live performances spread throughout the Kansai region.

Members:
• Takuya Yamanaka (山中 拓也) : Vocal, guitar
• Akira Akirakani (あきらかにあきら) : Bass, chorus
• Shigenobu Suzuki (鈴木 重伸) : Guitar
• Masaya Nakanishi (中西 雅哉) : Drums

(Source: generasia)

Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram WEAVER is a Japanese rock trio band under A-Sketch, a sub-label created by AMUSE in 2008. The trio formed in 2004 during high school in Kobe, Japan. They made their debut in 2009 with the digital single "Hakuchoumu". In 2010 they released their debut single "Hard to say I love you ~Iidasenakute~", which was used as the theme song for the drama Sunao ni Narenakute. Members: Birth Name: [杉本雄治 (Yuuji Sugimoto)](https://anilist.co/staff/154208/Yuuji-Sugimoto) Instrument(s): Vocals and Piano Main roles in the band: Lead Vocals/Pianist Birth Name: 奥野翔太 (Shota Okuno) Date of Birth: August 18, 1988 Instrument(s): Bass Main roles in the band: Playing the Bass and supporting vocals Birth Name: [河邉徹 (Tooru Kawabe)](https://anilist.co/staff/155425/Tooru-Kawabe) Date of Birth: June 28, 1988 Instrument(s): Drums Main roles in the band: Playing the Drums and supporting vocals Record Label: A-Sketch/antwork (Source: last.fm/generasia.com)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀山俊樹)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YasufumiSoejima/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/soejima_yasufumi/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ys19710313)

A director with past experience in computer graphics. Former CG animator and director at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO). He is currently affiliated with [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/).

__Place of Birth:__ Higashimurayama-shi, Tokyo, Japan
__Hometown:__ Kokubunji, Tokyo, Japan

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tokihiro.sasaki)**

__Hometown:__ Kokubunji, Tokyo, Japan

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tokihiro.sasaki)**

A Japanese director, series composer, episode director, animator, animation director, and storyboard artist.

Brother of [Kousuke Kawatsura](https://anilist.co/staff/116501/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ka2hikoTakayama) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/KatsuhikoTakayama00/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kimiyatrx)

Jiro Fujimoto is a Japanese animation supervisor known for his work on the TV adaptation of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by David Production. Fujimoto is an alumni of Nippon Animation. He is known to be credited through many aliases in the productions he's worked on.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taizouzo)

Mostly directs and storyboards nowadays, having more or less retired as an animator.
**Satoshi Oosedo** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dekopongas)

Affiliated with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Brother of [Kousuke Kawatsura](https://anilist.co/staff/116501/).
**Yukihiko Asaki (朝木幸彦)** is a Japanese production manager and episode director.
Sasaki Masaya (佐々木真哉) is a Japanese animator, episode director and storyboard artist.
